author: tersec
content: reasonable to either deprecate https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/#/Beacon/publishBlock or like https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/#/Beacon/publishBlockV2 make it require the fork to be specified? The autodetection of block based on fork is messy and decreasingly necessary except for some of these older APIs. Newer APIs properly mark it as required

author: tersec
content: the `getBlock` variations seem to all return the fork already, and this is mostly an issue specifically with blocks/block bodies. Might find more endpoints but so far deprecating this one alone should remove the requirement to have the beacon block fork REST JSON autodetection entirely

author: jgm
content: Yeah given we have v2 endpoints of these I don't see a reason why we can't deprecate v1.  It will still be a while until we actually remove it, though (I think we agreed on at least 1 complete hard fork being deprecated, so these endpoints could be removed with the fulu release).

author: tersec
content: sure, but at least having that happen eventually

author: jgm
content: Yeah it's definitely good to get started with deprecation of old endpoints.

author: tersec
content: in the meantime, I'm not even sure it makes sense to `publishBlock`/`publishBlindedBlock` (the only endpoints I can find) outside the current fork

author: tersec
content: properly behaving clients won't even be subscribed to the correct libp2p topics in general
